Name: Abating rats as a requirement for the issuance of a permit for new construction or a building alteration.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to abating rats as a requirement for the issuance of a permit for new construction or a building alteration.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1.  Subchapter 1 of chapter 1 of article 11 of title 27 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 27-160.1 to read as follows:
§27-160.1 Rat abatement.  No new building permit shall be issued unless the applicant has conducted appropriate trapping or baiting of rats at the site for which the permit is sought, and submits, with the application, a certification that such trapping or baiting has been performed.
§2. Subchapter 1 of chapter 1 of article 12 of title 27 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 27-162.1 to read as follows:
§27-162.1 Rat abatement.  No building alteration permit shall be issued unless the applicant has conducted appropriate trapping or baiting of rats at the site for which the permit is sought, and submits, with the application, a certification that such trapping or baiting has been performed.
§3.  This local law shall take effect thirty days after it shall become law, except that the commissioner of buildings shall take all actions as are necessary for its implementation prior to such effective date. 

DB
Int. 405/2004
